sentences: Kõik on otsas peale igaüks oma osa.
Igaüks teab, et see tões on.
context: In Estonian, 'igaüks' is a compound word formed from 'iga' (each/every) and 'üks' (one). It functions as an indefinite pronoun meaning 'everyone' or 'everybody'. The word refers to all people collectively without exception. When used in sentences, it typically appears at the beginning but can appear elsewhere depending on emphasis needs.
